Disposition: Disposition Process
   
  Definition and Options

What we do with a weapon system at the end of its operational life is a matter of considerable concern and study before the system is placed into operation. Part of the acquisition process deals with issues of disposition. This is a relatively recent development in logistics and reflects growing fiscal and environmental concerns as well as matters of operational effectiveness.

DoD 4160.21-M defines disposal as: the process of reutilizing, transferring, donating, selling, destroying, or other ultimate disposition of personal property.

When a weapon system is no longer required to perform its current role, there are a number of options for the disposition of the system.

Click on each of the four options in the right column to display a brief description. Once you have viewed all the information, you will be able to continue to the next page.
